required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Investigate the Safety and Tolerability of AZD8848 in Butyrylcholinesterase Deficient Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Non-controlled, Non-randomised, Parallel-group Study to Investigate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Single Ascending Doses of AZD 8848 Administered Intranasally to Male and Female Butyrylcholinesterase Deficient Subjects and to Sex and Age Matched Controls

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the safety and tolerability of AZD8848 in Butyrylcholinesterase deficient subjects in comparison with sex and age matched control subjects.

detailed_description.textblock: An Open, Non-controlled, Non-randomised, Parallel-group Study to Investigate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Single Ascending Doses of AZD 8848 Administered Intranasally to Male and Female Butyrylcholinesterase deficient Subjects and to Sex and Age matched Controls

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability will be assessed by a panel of measurements including adverse events (AEs), vital signs, ECG, laboratory variables, physical examination, and clinical inspection of the nose
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately prior to administration of the IP (Day 0)

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability will be assessed by a panel of measurements including adverse events (AEs), vital signs, ECG, laboratory variables, physical examination, and clinical inspection of the nose
Safety and tolerability will be assessed by a panel of measurements including adverse events (AEs), vital signs, ECG, laboratory variables, physical examination, and clinical inspection of the nose

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (concentration of AZD8848 and metabolite in plasma and urine)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to administration of the IP (Day 0) and repeated assessments during the first 48h.
Prior to administration of the IP (Day 0) and repeated assessments during the first 48h.

arm_group.description: AZD8848 given to BChE deficient subjects and age & gender matched control subjects

intervention.description: Nasal spray solution, intranasal, single ascending doses, 1.4 - 60 Î¼g

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BChE deficient subjects: The half-live of AZD8848 in plasma should be more than 20 minutes in an in vitro screening test
- Matched control subject: The half-live of AZD8848 in plasma should be less than 2 minutes in an in vitro screening test
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any clinically relevant abnormal findings in physical examination, laboratory assessments, vital signs or ECG
- Present or medical history of cardiovascular disease which, in the opinion of the investigator, may either put subject at risk because of participation in the study or influence the result of the study or the subject's ability to participate in the study
- Family history of autoimmune disease

clinical_study.keyword: BChE deficient subjects and matched control subject
